page.title: 08MINING-PIT VILLAGE OF YORE.
page.content: {LUMLEY}used to be a village of miners. Lack of transport meant they walked to work over footpaths crossing farmers' fields. They went dressed for work in steel-capped boots,"hoggers"(shortened trousers), knee pads and helmets, and carrying their "bait tins" and water bottles in their bags. They ate their "baits" in the pit.The 3-shift working day operated. The night-shift were roused from sleep by the "knocker-up". The pit buzzer sounded for work to begin, when accidents happened and at New Year. Returning miners, jet black, washed in a tin bath before the fire, their wives picking the pieces of coal out of their backs. In their leisure time miners played billiards, tended their allotments, grew large prize leeks and raced pigeons, whippets and greyhounds. {J.Walker. { }
